message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the index coding problem, which is a problem in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with broadcasting and side-information, which are topics related to networked systems and communication. Hence, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is also a likely sub-category. The paper uses graph theory to model the problem and prove bounds, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also deals with the complexity of finding lower bounds, which is a topic related to computational complexity, and hence, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with optimization and achieving upper bounds, which could also make it relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
